Benchmarking MSstats using the Ionstar Dataset

FGCZ - (Draft)

01 June, 2021

Source: vignettes/MSStatsBenchmark.Rmd
MSStatsBenchmark.Rmd

Setting up analysis

library(MSstats)
library(magrittr)

# Read in MaxQuant files
datadir <- file.path(find.package("prolfquaData") , "quantdata")
inputMQfile <-  file.path(datadir,
                          "MAXQuant_IonStar2018_PXD003881.zip")
inputAnnotation <- file.path(datadir, "annotation_Ionstar2018_PXD003881.xlsx")

proteinGroups <- read.table(unz(inputMQfile,"proteinGroups.txt"), sep = "\t", header = TRUE)

infile <- read.table(unz(inputMQfile,"evidence.txt"), sep="\t", header = TRUE)
dim(infile)
## [1] 818610     61
annotation <- readxl::read_xlsx(inputAnnotation)
msstas_annotation <- annotation %>% dplyr::select(raw.file, Condition = sample, BioReplicate = run_ID)
msstas_annotation$IsotopeLabelType <- "L"
msstas_annotation <- msstas_annotation %>% tidyr::unite("Experiment", Condition, BioReplicate, sep="_", remove = FALSE)
# Read in annotation including condition and biological replicates per run.
# Users should make this annotation file. It is not the output from MaxQuant.

rf <- unique(infile$Raw.file)
rf <- data.frame(Raw.file = rf, raw.file = tolower(rf))
msstas_annotation <- dplyr::inner_join(rf, msstas_annotation)
msstas_annotation$raw.file <- NULL
raw <- MaxQtoMSstatsFormat(evidence = infile, 
                           annotation = msstas_annotation, 
                           proteinGroups = proteinGroups,
                           removeProtein_with1Peptide = TRUE)
## INFO  [2021-06-01 13:16:16] ** Raw data from MaxQuant imported successfully.
## INFO  [2021-06-01 13:16:16] ** Rows with values of Potentialcontaminant equal to + are removed 
## INFO  [2021-06-01 13:16:19] ** Rows with values of Reverse equal to + are removed 
## INFO  [2021-06-01 13:16:21] ** Rows with values of Potentialcontaminant equal to + are removed 
## INFO  [2021-06-01 13:16:21] ** Rows with values of Reverse equal to + are removed 
## INFO  [2021-06-01 13:16:21] ** Rows with values of Onlyidentifiedbysite equal to + are removed 
## INFO  [2021-06-01 13:16:21] ** + Contaminant, + Reverse, + Potential.contaminant, + Only.identified.by.site proteins are removed.
## INFO  [2021-06-01 13:16:24] ** Raw data from MaxQuant cleaned successfully.
## INFO  [2021-06-01 13:16:24] ** Using provided annotation.
## INFO  [2021-06-01 13:16:24] ** Run labels were standardized to remove symbols such as '.' or '%'.
## INFO  [2021-06-01 13:16:24] ** The following options are used:
##   - Features will be defined by the columns: PeptideSequence, PrecursorCharge
##   - Shared peptides will be removed.
##   - Proteins with a single feature will be removed.
##   - Features with less than 3 measurements across runs will be removed.
## INFO  [2021-06-01 13:16:25] ** Features with all missing measurements across runs are removed.
## INFO  [2021-06-01 13:16:26] ** Shared peptides are removed.
## INFO  [2021-06-01 13:16:28] ** Multiple measurements in a feature and a run are summarized by summaryforMultipleRows: max
## INFO  [2021-06-01 13:16:28] ** Features with one or two measurements across runs are removed.
## INFO  [2021-06-01 13:16:29] Proteins with a single feature are removed.
## INFO  [2021-06-01 13:16:32] ** Run annotation merged with quantification data.
## INFO  [2021-06-01 13:16:33] ** Features with one or two measurements across runs are removed.
## INFO  [2021-06-01 13:16:33] ** Fractionation handled.
## INFO  [2021-06-01 13:16:35] ** Updated quantification data to make balanced design. Missing values are marked by NA
## INFO  [2021-06-01 13:16:35] ** Finished preprocessing. The dataset is ready to be processed by the dataProcess function.
QuantData <- dataProcess(raw)
## INFO  [2021-06-01 13:16:40] ** Log2 intensities under cutoff = 17.373  were considered as censored missing values.
## INFO  [2021-06-01 13:16:40] ** Log2 intensities = NA were considered as censored missing values.

Defining Contrasts and computing group comparisons

Contrasts <- c(
  "dilution_(9/3)_3" =   "dilution.e - dilution.a",
  "dilution_(9/4.5)_2" =   "dilution.e - dilution.b",
  "dilution_(9/6)_1.5" =   "dilution.e - dilution.c",
  "dilution_(9/7.5)_1.2" =   "dilution.e - dilution.d",
  
  "dilution_(7.5/3)_2.5" =   "dilution.d - dilution.a",
  "dilution_(7.5/4.5)_1.6(6)" =   "dilution.d - dilution.b",
  "dilution_(7.5/6)_1.25" =   "dilution.d - dilution.c",
  
  "dilution_(6/3)_2" =   "dilution.c - dilution.a",
  "dilution_(6/4.5)_1.3(3)" =   "dilution.c - dilution.b",
  
  "dilution_(4.5/3)_1.5" =   "dilution.b - dilution.a"
)
relevantContrasts <- c("dilution_(9/7.5)_1.2",
                       "dilution_(7.5/6)_1.25",
                       "dilution_(6/4.5)_1.3(3)",
                       "dilution_(4.5/3)_1.5" )
Contrasts[names(Contrasts) %in% relevantContrasts]
##      dilution_(9/7.5)_1.2     dilution_(7.5/6)_1.25   dilution_(6/4.5)_1.3(3) 
## "dilution.e - dilution.d" "dilution.d - dilution.c" "dilution.c - dilution.b" 
##      dilution_(4.5/3)_1.5 
## "dilution.b - dilution.a"
levels(QuantData$ProcessedData$GROUP_ORIGINAL)
## NULL
# based on multiple comparisons  (T1 vs T3; T1 vs T7; T1 vs T9)
comparison1 <- matrix(c(0,0,0,-1,1),nrow = 1)
comparison2 <- matrix(c(0,0,-1,1,0),nrow = 1)
comparison3 <- matrix(c(0,-1,1,0,0),nrow = 1)
comparison4 <- matrix(c(-1,1,0,0,0),nrow = 1)
comparison <- rbind(comparison1,comparison2, comparison3, comparison4)
row.names(comparison) <- c("dilution_(9/7.5)_1.2","dilution_(7.5/6)_1.25","dilution_(6/4.5)_1.3(3)","dilution_(4.5/3)_1.5")
colnames(comparison) <- c("a","b","c","d","e")
testResultMultiComparisons <- groupComparison(contrast.matrix=comparison, data=QuantData)

Benchmarking

library(prolfqua)
#saveRDS(bb, file = "inst/Benchresults/MSStatsGroupComparisonResult.RDS")
#bb <- readRDS(file = "inst/Benchresults/MSStatsGroupComparisonResult.RDS")

ttd <- prolfqua::ionstar_bench_preprocess(bb, idcol = "Protein")
head(ttd$data)
##                 Protein                   Label       log2FC        SE

## 2 -1.69843500 15 0.11006653  0.6038811  <NA>         0.2708333
## 3 -0.86717796 15 0.39950477  0.8274025  <NA>         0.1770833
## 4  0.88861432 15 0.38823853  0.8972674  <NA>         0.1875000
## 5 -2.37564059 15 0.03127735  0.3012502  <NA>         0.2380952
## 6  1.39688906 15 0.18277191  0.7120014  <NA>         0.2261905
##   ImputationPercentage species    TP
## 1            0.3229167   HUMAN FALSE
## 2            0.2708333   HUMAN FALSE
## 3            0.1770833   HUMAN FALSE
## 4            0.1875000   HUMAN FALSE
## 5            0.2380952   HUMAN FALSE
## 6            0.2261905   HUMAN FALSE
benchmark_msstats <- make_benchmark(ttd$data,
                                   contrast = "Label",
                                toscale = c("pvalue"),
                                fcestimate = "log2FC",
                                benchmark = list(
                                  list(sc = "log2FC", desc = TRUE),
                                  list(sc = "Tvalue", desc = TRUE),
                                  list(sc = "scaled.pvalue", desc = TRUE)
                                ),  
                                model_description = "MSStats",
                                model_name = "MSStats",
                                FDRvsFDP = list(list(sc = "adj.pvalue", desc = FALSE))
, hierarchy = c("Protein"), summarizeNA = "Tvalue"
)
sum(benchmark_msstats$smc$summary$Protein)
## [1] 4034
sumarry <- benchmark_msstats$smc$summary
table_facade(sumarry, caption = "nr of proteins with 0, 1, 2, 3 missing contrasts.")
nr of proteins with 0, 1, 2, 3 missing contrasts.
nr_missing Protein
0 3976
1 40
2 16
3 2 
res <- benchmark_msstats$pAUC_summaries()
res$barp

ROC curves 

#res$ftable

benchmark_msstats$plot_FDRvsFDP()

benchmark_msstats$plot_FDPvsTPR()
